snippet.title: Army of newly qualified carpenters building homes for Fiji poor
snippet.content: Rebuilding continues in Fiji, nearly 18 months after the country was ravaged by Cyclone Winston, and in a growing number of cases, people are doing it for themselves. armed with carpentry skills they've learnt through a progamme run by Habitat for Humanity. So far the non-government organisation has helped 800 people, including 50 women, to qualify as community carpenters with a certificate from the Australia-Pacific Technical College. As a result, Habitat for Humanity's chair, Hamidan Bibi says more than 100 homes for the poor have already been completed, and their target is for 200 by the end of the year.
